intro: Psychotria nitida, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy texture. Psychotria nitida is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests.
